Research Highlights

I am primarily interested in how physics-based simulation can be applied to study biological phenomena. You can find a list of my research interests and publications here.

Me

I am a scientist, finishing my PhD in biophysics at the University of York focused on DNA topology and architectural proteins, now working as a postdoc at the University of Bristol .

More ›

Molecular Simulation

Most of the work I do involves computational simulations. Here is a personal favourite example of the technique, using it to investigate DNA supercoiling done by Dr. Agnes Noy.

Publications

DNA bending proteins vs supercoiling

Watson et al. investigate the active role DNA can play in protein-DNA interactions via supercoiling and how it affects how IHF plays it's architectural roles. Read More ›
